Shilpa has 10+ years of experience as a data scientist in various companies in the San Francisco / Bay Area where she has solved some hard business problems, done innovative work and delivered customer-impacting solutions. Currently she is an Adjunct Professor of Industrial and Systems Engineering at San Jose State University. She is passionate about statistics / data science pedagogy and volunteers her time mentoring middle/high school girls through More Active Girls In Computing. She holds a doctorate in Industrial Engineering (Applied Statistics with minor in Optimization).

Shilpa is a certified Mental Health First Aider. 

Courses Taught:

ISE 194

ISE 201

ISE 244

ISE 202

Welcome to my [digital garden](https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/09/03/1007716/digital-gardens-let-you-cultivate-your-own-little-bit-of-the-internet/), where i explore my adventures in pedagogy.
